comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12

Since the dawn of history string "Binary File" in dialog which you get after trying to download an executable in Firefox is not translated. Screen attached.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try to download an executable.
2. In the file type you can see untranslated "Binary File".
Actual Results:  
Untranslated string

Expected Results:  
"Binary File" should be localized
comments.creator: krystian4842@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
that's a string which comes from the OS or server. Nothing we can do about it.
Closing as INVALID.
comments.creator: adrian.kalla+bugzilla@gmail.com

that's a string which comes from the OS or server. Nothing we can do about it.

comments.raw_text: How come the OS with Polish language return English "Binary File" string?
comments.creator: krystian4842@gmail.com
comments.author: krystian4842@gmail.com
comments.text: How come the OS with Polish language return English "Binary File" string?

comments.raw_text: It is not the user's operating system. It is the server that is sending the file.
comments.creator: kbrosnan@mozilla.com
comments.author: kbrosnan@mozilla.com
comments.text: It is not the user's operating system. It is the server that is sending the file.

comments.author: krystian4842@gmail.com
comments.text:
I don't know if this is used in the actual Firefox but...
http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla2.0/source/uriloader/exthandler/nsExternalHelperAppService.cpp#561

I REOPEN this bug, if you think that I shouldn't - sorry.
comments.creator: krystian4842@gmail.com

comments.creator: krystian4842@gmail.com
comments.text: Can anybody that knows Firefox' code well say if that's the case (comment #8) and is there any way to let the translators localize it?
comments.author: krystian4842@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Can anybody that knows Firefox' code well say if that's the case (comment #8) and is there any way to let the translators localize it?

The exthandler code is a bit of a mess to trace through, but I'd suspect that is indeed the source of the string that's being displayed. And the code should probably thus be changed to allow localizing those.
comments.creator: jdinbox@gmail.com
comments.text: The exthandler code is a bit of a mess to trace through, but I'd suspect that is indeed the source of the string that's being displayed. And the code should probably thus be changed to allow localizing those.
comments.author: jdinbox@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: I presume this won't be taken care of before 4.0 ships?
comments.author: krystian4842@gmail.com
comments.text: I presume this won't be taken care of before 4.0 ships?
comments.creator: krystian4842@gmail.com
bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.text:
Correct.

The code linked to in comment 8 is probably the right thing.  At the same time, making that stuff localizable could hurt performance in some cases...

I'd be happy to review a patch that makes those localizable and shows no perf impact.
